title: Sit down one place (A)
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Aboriginal Australia/Aboriginal Australians - Social life and customs
Agriculture, Business, Commerce & Industry/Aboriginal Australians - Business enterprises
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Aboriginal Australians - Social conditions
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Economic assistance
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Culture conflict
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Aboriginal Australians - Government relations
description: Compares the nomads, a group of 500 Aborigines led by a white man, Don McLeod, in the Pilbara, Western Australia, with the Mugarinya people led by Aborigine, Peter Coffin. The former have little governmental help and find it difficult to come to terms with the disintegration of their culture, the latter run their own station and receive assistance.
